Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http.websocket

package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http.websocket
WebSocket protocol implementation (RFC 6455).

This package provides WebSocket support for real-time bidirectional communication between clients and the server. WebSocket connections are established via HTTP upgrade from the HTTP server.

Key Components

  • WebSocketConnection - Handles the WebSocket protocol after upgrade
  • WebSocketFrame - Represents a WebSocket protocol frame
  • WebSocketHandshake - Handles the HTTP upgrade handshake
  • WebSocketProtocolException - Exception for protocol violations

Features

  • Text and binary message types
  • Message fragmentation
  • Ping/pong heartbeats
  • Close frame handling with status codes
  • Per-message compression (permessage-deflate)
  • Subprotocol negotiation

WebSocket Frame Types

  • Text frames - UTF-8 encoded text messages
  • Binary frames - Binary data messages
  • Ping frames - Keepalive requests
  • Pong frames - Keepalive responses
  • Close frames - Connection termination

Servlet Integration

For servlet-based applications, WebSocket endpoints can be defined using the JSR 356 WebSocket API annotations.

Author:
Chris Burdess
See Also:

    HTTP/2 framing support shared by server and client.

  • Class
    Description
    WebSocketConnection
    Abstract base class for WebSocket connections.
    WebSocketConnection.CloseCodes
    Standard WebSocket close codes as defined in RFC 6455 Section 7.4.1.
    WebSocketConnection.State
    WebSocket connection states as defined in RFC 6455.
    WebSocketConnection.WebSocketTransport
    Interface for the underlying transport mechanism.
    WebSocketFrame
    WebSocket frame implementation following RFC 6455.
    WebSocketHandshake
    WebSocket handshake utilities implementing RFC 6455.
    WebSocketProtocolException
    Exception thrown when WebSocket protocol violations are detected.
